Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SB2 (Synthetic AMPs, Thanatin variant, Arg-rich; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, insects, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Wang G, Watson KM, Mishra B, Lushnikova T, Buckheit RW Jr. 2011
Literature.Reference: J AIDS Clinic Res S2:003. doi:10.4172/2155-6113.S2-003.Wang HIV screen project
Literature.Title:
De Novo Design of Antiviral and Antibacterial Peptides with 
Varying Loop Structures

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is poorly similar (85.71%) toSB1. R: 29%; I: 14%.Chemical modification:  one disulfide bond C11-C18.Activity: inhibited Human Immunodeficiency Virus Type 1 HIV-1IIIB (EC50 3.33 ug/ml).Toxicity: TC50 >100 ug/ml in CEM-SS cells.SAR: Compared to SB1, the increase of anti-HIV activity of this RR variant can be attributed to additional arginines as we observed previously (Wang et al., 2010.
